data.event: A rapidly growing brush fire made commuting an ordeal for drivers on Interstate 4 on Friday night and threatens to close the highway today between DeLand and Daytona Beach if winds flare up as expected.

event.title: today between DeLand and Daytona Beach if winds flare

data.event: A rapidly growing brush fire made commuting an ordeal for drivers on Interstate 4 on Friday night and threatens to close the highway today between DeLand and Daytona Beach if winds flare up as expected.

event.title: were burning in Volusia County on Friday

data.event: Fifteen brush fires were burning in Volusia County on Friday, and another was under control in Osceola.
The largest, spanning 800 acres near State Road 44, was first reported March 6 and was caused by people, according to the U.S. Forestry Service Web site.

event.title: doubled in size from Thursday morning

data.event: It doubled in size from Thursday morning to Friday night, said Shelley Szafraniec, a Volusia County spokeswoman.
It doubled in size from Thursday morning to Friday night, said Shelley Szafraniec, a Volusia County spokeswoman.

event.title: turns the rain spigot off for Florida during the winter

data.event: The phenomenon, which shifts Pacific Ocean temperatures and North American wind patterns, usually turns the rain spigot off for Florida during the winter and spring.
``The conditions are really stacked against them [firefighters] right now.''
Meanwhile, a 300-acre-plus brush fire was contained by Friday night in east Osceola County.
The fire started Thursday, died down and flared again Friday.
